Class Element

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
pl.gda.pg.elektronikaodpodstaw.simulation.Element
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ammeter, Capacitor, CurrentSource, Inductor, Resistor, VoltageSource, Voltmeter, Wire
public abstract class Element extends Component
Represents a base class for all electrical elements in the simulation. Provides shared properties and methods for handling graphical representation, value manipulation, and node assignments of elements.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Element

      public Element(Point start, Point end)
      Constructs an `Element` with specified start and end points. Calculates the midpoints and determines orientation based on the points.
      Parameters:
      start - the starting point of the element.
      end - the ending point of the element.

      Returns:
      the current count of instances of the specified class.

    • ValueToUnit

      private static String ValueToUnit(float value)
      Converts a numerical value into metric prefix but special for simulation.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the formatted value in metric prefix specific for simulation.

    • CenterValueTool

      Centers and draws a value string on the specified graphics context.
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics context used for rendering.
      value - the value to draw.
      centerX - the horizontal center point.
      centerY - the vertical center point.

    • UnitToValue

      public static float UnitToValue(String value)
      Converts a special metric prefix to its float value representation.
      Parameters:
      value - the special metric prefix to convert (e.g., "10k").
      Returns:
      the numeric value of the prefix.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string format is invalid.
